content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Great simple puzzle, although dilemma is not spelled dillema :(

I think the Validator 1 is not of the same nature than other tests : only one flavour input. Maybe you could paired it with another new test and change the Validator 1 so that it's more similar to the Test 1.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: good idea

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good One

Binary output issue
* According to the contribution guidelines, binary output should be avoided for clashes. As your clash accepts only two possible answers (either "Fired!" or "Hired!"), it suffers from the binary output issue. Please change the output requirement so that there are more than two possible answers in total.

Goal
* Please format "Fired!" and "Hired!" as {{constants}} and remove the quotation marks.

Input
* Please format all line numbers in <<bold>>, e.g. "LIne 1" becomes "<<Line 1>>", "Next [[N]] Lines" becomes "<<Next [[N]] Lines>>".

* Next N Lines: Please add that the flavours are space-separated.

Output
* Both phrases lack an exclamation mark.

* Please format "Fired!" and "Hired!" as {{constants}} and remove the quotation marks.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement, e.g. "write answer".

Game modes
* It seems too difficult to guess the requirement in Reverse mode.

Thanks.
Thank you for your feedback. I believe I've fixed all the issues you raised.

Thank you. My earlier concerns have been addressed. The updated contribution still needs a bit of work:

Output
* Please mention that the flavours are space-separated.

* Please mention in what order the flavours should be output.

Cases
* There is only one test case which requires the output of two flavours. Would you please change Validator 2 so that it requires the output of two flavours (a different answer from "Chocolate Strawberry" this time)?

* Please add one more pair of cases (test + validator) where all three flavours need to be output.

Thanks.

Thank you for your continued feedback. I've mentioned that the flavours are space-separated and the order that the flavours should be output in.

I've also changed and added cases as you advised, which have been all verified.

Looking good. Just one more fix:

Output
* Please add "space-separated and" before "ordered".

Thanks.
Done. Thank you for your assistance.
